attributes.action: Make it illegal for pension funds to be plundered.
attributes.background: Once again an "entrepreneur" has plundered the pension fund of many working people - this time British Home Stores.  The shortfall will have to be met by the British Taxpayer while the "entrepreneur" walks away.
attributes.additional_details: When Robert Maxwell, another "entrepreneur", plundered pension funds  years ago there was a public outcry but nothing has been done to prevent this happening again.  Why not?  Pension funds should be ring-fenced so that they cannot be plundered.  The money which will have to be found to meet this pension gap would be spent better on doctors, nurses, the NHS in general, better treatment of the older generation and many other causes. Meanwhile the person responsible for this walks away.

attributes.action: Pause, plan and review before a decision on Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty.
attributes.background:
1. Wait 4 to 6 months to allow the parties to resolve their internal conflicts.
2. Take steps to address the divisions that the referendum has revealed in our communities.
3. Hold an independent enquiry into allegations of disinformation during the campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
4. Establish a clear plan of what Brexit would entail; for example, movement of people, economic and trading relations, rights at work, environmental legislation and the future of Projects currently receiving EU funding.
5. This plan should be subject to public consultation and democratic process, including the views of 16 and 17 year olds before a final decision is taken about whether to enact Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty.

attributes.action: I want my mum to stay in the UK although she doesn't have a permanent visa.
attributes.background: In August my family visited the UK to meet my sick grandfather. We realised he was dying from Parkinsons and decided to stay and look after him, however, my mum had a visit visa and the government wouldn't change it. The government is forcing my mum to leave me, my sister and my dad. Please help us.
attributes.additional_details: Parkinson's disease is a degenerative disease meaning every time I visit my granddad he loses his memory even more. My family and I decided to stay in the UK so we could spend the most amount of time as a family with my granddad. However, my mum has a visit visa and that doesn't allow her to stay with me. That means we have have to leave my dying granddad to stay with my mum or my mum has to leave us for a minimum of a year. That is very stressful because I love both my granddad and mum.

attributes.action: Call for a second EU referendum as the first did not have a clear mandate.
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is an irrevocable decision, which will have far reaching consequences. Due to this we must only leave if there is a clear mandate from the people, which does not exist at present since 48% voted IN. It is vital that there is a second referendum and that a clear mandate is reached.

attributes.action: Stop allowing the NHS to go into decline, put it back  in the public domain
attributes.background: Private companies are charging extortionate fees which are being paid for with public money.  Voters should be asked how they want their money to be to be spent or if they want to use their money to pay for high managerial positions which could pay for training for doctors and nurses.
attributes.additional_details: The speed at which the NHS is being placed into private hands is steadily increasing with more  contracts going to private providers, even when the NHS contracts  cost less for the same services. The money to pay those private companies comes from public money which should be going to the support of the NHS.  By placing the NHS completely in the public hands, Where we are given the ability to make decisions on what happens to our Health Service people would have more respect on how it is used.

attributes.action: Requesting the British Government to review the FCO travel advice to Tunisia.
attributes.background: We believe that the time is now appropriate to request a removal of the restrictive travel advice which has had such a devastating effect on the country's progress and economic stability.
attributes.additional_details: The travel advice makes it impossible for the Tunisian/British community in the UK to obtain comprehensive travel insurance from conventional UK companies and removes the need for competitive pricing for the traveller. This is restricting people’s freedom to live their lives.

attributes.action: Make not having a changing bed and hoist in disabled toilets illegal
attributes.background: Many families with children who have conditions and impairments have to change their children on the floors of toilets. We believe that this is wrong. A safe and clean place to go to the toilet and be changed should be a human right. If you agree then please join us and sign here.

attributes.action: Make LAs fund parental chosen legal representation at SEND appeals
attributes.background: LAs are increasingly instructing expensive, external legal firms to represent them at SEND tribunals.  Often this will be a barrister, regardless of whether the parents of the disabled child is represented.  Tribunals are meant to be light touch, and families are not being given a fair hearing.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents are at breaking point, constantly fighting for their disabled childrens' educational rights, while LAs spare no expense to 'win' tribunal claims.  
http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/09687590701259674?journalCode=

https://onedrive.live.com/redir?page=view&resid=3EA9503A53A03A77!230&authkey=!APLwZXHPVC_Xem8
To redress this imbalance, LAs should either not be allowed to instruct external legal representation, or if they do, they should fund legal representation of parents choice.

attributes.action: Review planning policy and it's interpretation at local level
attributes.background: Oakland employs 245 and is recognised as a top 100 local employer and also in the top 1000 companies to Inspire Britain. Bromsgrove Council stated that further building on Oakland’s site is not welcome, commenting Oakland is “growing like topsy” and have asked Oakland to relocate out of the county.
attributes.additional_details:
Oakland is seeing its whole existence under threat due to its local Council blocking any building plans.

The Council’s planners argument for refusal is based on protection of Green Belt, in this case derelict warehouses.

Oakland is intent on highlighting the disparity between what Central Government is saying and what Local Government is doing.

To understand better our situation please follow the link www.plannersblockbusiness.co.uk and watch some of our videos to understand our frustrations.

attributes.action: Following EU Referendum, Brexit team to be formed from elected MEPs and MPs.
attributes.background: Most of our elected MPs do not understand the anti-democratic EU (or they would have campaigned for Leave). MEPs know its structures and the legislation we may be pushed to accept part of. In the national interest any legitimate Brexit negotiation team must comprise our elected MEPs and MPs.

attributes.action: Allergen and nutrition information to be provided by all food establishments.
attributes.background: Since December 2014 it has been made a necessity that 14 indetified food allergens including nuts, fish, milk and eggs must be provided on food packaging and on menus where food packaging isn't readily available (Food Standards Agency, 2013). However this doesn't cover the full nutritional content.
attributes.additional_details:
I myself have been a type 1 insulin-dependent diabetic for 16 years, and as part of my condition management I, like thousands of others, need to know the nutrition, particularly carbohydrate content of the foods I am eating in order to calculate my insulin requirements.

Diabetes is a life-threatening chronic health condition and it is extremely surprising how many food establishments are only able to provide allergen information and not the full nutritional content of the items on their menus.

attributes.action: Save the Battle of Britain display at the Royal Aircraft Museum.
attributes.background: While at the RAF Museum I saw that many of the exhibits in the Battle of Britain Hall were being dismantled.  It appears the BoB Museum will be no more and the aircraft therein will be dispersed, either to areas within the Hendon site, RAF Cosford or put in storage.

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens voting rights in a second EU referendum
attributes.background: Many UK citizens living outside the UK were not eligible to vote in the EU referendum held on June 23, 2016. This was inappropriate and unjust as British membership of the EU has a direct impact on these citizens. In a second referendum, all UK citizens must have the right to vote.
attributes.additional_details: UK citizens living outside the UK for more than 15 years did not have the right to vote in the first EU referendum of June 23, 2016.

attributes.action: Get Southern trains contract cancelled in the South East
attributes.background: Tired of the excuses and the prices paid for train services on these routes only to have trains cancelled, constantly late and you cannot even get a refund on days Southern did not even have a train running all day. Let us get Southern's contract cancelled as soon as possible!

attributes.action: Force Govia Thameslink Railway to pay compensation to all season ticket
attributes.background:
I call on the government to force Govia Thameslink Railway to pay monetary compensation to all season ticket holders on Southern operated routes at a level of 20% of their season ticket value. 

GTR recently cut 350 services from all lines added to previous disruption, customers need compensating
attributes.additional_details: Www.bbc.Co.uk/news/uk-england-36701300

attributes.action: Stop the roll out of grammar schools and work to close down current grammars
attributes.background: There has been speculation that the government are looking into lifting the ban on new grammar schools and this would create more inequality than social mobility. In areas where there are grammars, secondary schools receive a lot more Free School Meal funding etc. The grammar system doesn't work.
attributes.additional_details: I recently wrote to Cllr. Zahir Mohammad, Cabinet Member for Schools in Bucks, about funding inequalities between grammars and secondaries and his response was this, "The non-selective schools receive considerably more support from increased funding e.g. per pupil Free School meals, Prior Attainment, English as an additional language and Pupil Premium etc and this can be quite significantly more than grammars.". The 11+ is biased against poorer kids and this system cannot be rolled out further.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to wear a helmet on trikes and quad bikes
attributes.background: I was in a trike crash which killed my boyfriend, who was driving. I woke up in hospital with serious injuries and two policeman by my bed. They said wearing a helmet on a trike was not a legal requirement. But I don't want anyone else to go through what myself, my boyfriend and our families have.
attributes.additional_details:
Helmets are only compulsory for motor bicycles, not motor tricycles.

Motor Cycles (Protective Helmets) Regulations 1988. 
Statutory Instrument 1998 No 1807.

attributes.action: Do not bring in a fee/charge to use Recycling Centres nationwide
attributes.background: My local council and I am sure many will follow suit are planning to start charging for certain types of waste brought to the Recycling Centre. I would like the Government to stop this charge as I fear it will encourage fly tipping.

attributes.action: Parliament debates the legality of EU treaties with regard to Vienna Convention.
attributes.background:
Article 53, Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties: 1969 states:  'A treaty is void if, at the time of its conclusion, it conflicts with a peremptory norm of general international law.'  

Peremptory norm includes the removal of sovereignty and the removal of law not specifically repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
It is recognised that EU Treaties entail removal of National Sovereignty and abrogate National Law not specifically repealed which includes the Treason Laws.   Parliament is sovereign except that it shall not diminish its own sovereignty.

As Parliament at various times has seen fit to transfer sovereignty to the EU, it is illegal under International Law and should cease forthwith including any procedures laid down by the EU for secession from the EU and withdraw unilaterally,

attributes.action: A Bill for The Protection, Breeding Limitation and Monitoring Law for Canines
attributes.background:
We are calling on David Cameron to make additions in the current law to protect the welfare/safety and breeding limitations of Canines.
Dogs should be given the care/respect they deserve and treated respectfully. 
For far too long they have been seen as a way of making profit and mistreated.

attributes.action: Review Her Majesty’s Revenue and Customs Widening Access claim process.
attributes.background: 1000's of NHS Professionals have been waiting for over a year for the HMRC to process refund claims. The HMRC should be set specific timeframes to process claims. There is evidence of inconsistent information being given by the HMRC to claimants and this is totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Her Majesty’s Revenue and Customs (HMRC) has stated that NHS employed staff also in full-time education are exempt from Tax and NI up to an annual allowance on earnings of £15,480, whilst in training, provided they meet certain criteria. Claims for refunds of tax and NI can be made for the period September 1999 to March 2013. 

This process has not been advertised to NHS professionals. The HMRC has made and error collecting Tax/NI and should rightfully correct this with complete transparency.

attributes.action: Abolish Universal Credit and keep Tax Credits and Child Tax Credits.
attributes.background: Due to issues around late payments, vastly reduced payments call center advisers that are ill informed, sanctions that are unrealistic, failing to deal with claims at basic levels. Forcing people into poverty and debt, vastly reduced rates for disabled children/adults. Plus an Incompetent IT system.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/03/universal-credit-cost-cutting-treasury-benefit-reform-resolution

http://www.theregister.co.uk/2016/05/03/universal_credit_it_could_start_to_creak_think_tank_report

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/universal-credit-will-increase-child-poverty-mps-warn-a7023061.html

http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/universal-credit-cuts-hit-liverpool-11313093

attributes.action: Make all infant formula packaging plain and display clear health warnings.
attributes.background: According to a recent study published in The Lancet, the U.K. has the lowest breastfeeding rates in the world. Breastfeeding is by far the healthier choice for mother and baby. However, currently health warnings are portrayed as "benefits of breastfeeding" rather than risks of artificial feeding.
attributes.additional_details: Formula companies spend a vast amount of money on making their product attractive to consumers and this aggressive marketing undermines a woman's ability to breastfeed. Switching from breastfeeding to formula puts a greater strain on an already stretched NHS as it increases the risk of diarrhoea, obesity, and ear and lung infections to name but a few. The Lancet states that "from tobacco, to sugar, to formula milk, the most vulnerable suffer when commercial interests collide with public health."

attributes.action: To end linear A-levels and reinstate AS examinations
attributes.background: A-levels are a very important part of a college student's life. It is already very hard and sitting Linear A-level exams at the end of two years is more like a memory test rather than testing a student’s abilities. Linear A-levels have already been used in the past and have not worked out very well.
attributes.additional_details: A-levels are becoming a linear two-year course which means that students must study the course for a full two years and AS-level will no longer count towards the final A-level grade. The nature of this change is to make A-levels tougher, despite the fact that A-level exams are already an important and very stressful part of a student's life. The House of Lords agreed that students should have a vote as this affects students everywhere; however, this was declined, denying us the chance to oppose.

attributes.action: All local council authorities must include childminders in free childcare scheme
attributes.background: Currently, it is not compulsory for local authorities to include childminders in any free hours childcare initiative. This is un-balanced and biased. Many parents prefer childminders as an alternative, for some, they need the flexibility. Childminders have to adhere to the same practices and rules.
attributes.additional_details: scma and care inspectorate sites will provide evidence of legislation and training.

attributes.action: Abolish the 'Dangerous Dogs Act 1991'
attributes.background: Everyday innocent dogs around the UK are dragged from their homes, stuffed into kennel's with other petrified dogs away form their owners and are 'destroyed'. A large number of these dogs are just puppies and have never shown any signs of aggression. They are dying due to breed discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Its about time we started to realise that no dogs are dangerous, only owners. We have known this for centuries yet we still allow criminals to breed these types of animals excluded within the Dangerous Dogs Act and we have almost zero accountability over our pet owners within the United Kingdom. 

We must propose a new system in which owners/breeders are held accountable for their animal no matter what breed and encourage education rather than destruction with this issue.

attributes.action: Ask the EU Parliament to vote on the UK’s Renegotiation before the Referendum
attributes.background:
The European Parliament will not vote on Cameron’s renegotiation of our EU membership until after we vote in the referendum.

The European Parliament Vice President said many MEPs will resist it, and it is no more binding than a deal ‘hammered out down the local bazaar'.
attributes.additional_details:
We, the British people, must know what we are voting for on 23rd June.

What does a vote to "Remain" mean if MEPs can reverse such a fundamental tenet of our reasons for staying? There must be a binding vote with a clear outcome.

For Cameron's "emergency brake" to come into force, the European Parliament must vote to modify the EU directive on free movement.

The British Government must request to put its renegotiation to the test in the European Parliament before we go to the ballot box.

attributes.action: Hold an urgent referendum to change voting to Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: The EU referendum has demonstrated that our current democratic system doesn't work. But it has proved that people want more of a voice. We urge a referendum on electoral reform so that our elected representatives actually represent us; we advocate Proportional Representation as the solution.

attributes.action: Create a UK Register of Arms Brokers
attributes.background:
While many arms brokers work within the law, some unscrupulous brokers are responsible for the illegitimate and illegal trade of weapons, including to terrorist groups and in war zones. 

A Register of Arms Brokers would better regulate this trade, and prevent criminals from dealing in weapons.
attributes.additional_details:
Responsible and robust control of the arms trade is one of the most crucial ways to uphold the rule of law and protect civilians across the world from violence and oppression.

As a signatory of the Arms Trade Treaty, the UK is expected to create a Register of Arms Brokers. It allows for greater scrutiny of brokers and is a vetting mechanism to ensure a safe and legitimate trade of weapons.

For more info: 
Amnesty International https://goo.gl/1FGCO8 
Saferworld http://goo.gl/aX6ljP

attributes.action: Change law to make  Dog Owners responsible for their Dogs that attack Pets
attributes.background: Too many pets are being attacked by out of control dogs and nothing can be done about it as it's not a police matter.
attributes.additional_details: So let's see if we can change the law, as since 1871 the law says a dog on dog attack is not a police matter. This petition is to see if we can get the law changed that  owners of dogs with a history of aggression/attack MUST be on lead or muzzled if level of aggression is high in open/public spaces.

attributes.action: Establish an inquiry into Community and District Hospital Services in Devon
attributes.background: Community Hospital beds have been closed across the area and now the Success Regime is consulting on closing all acute services at North Devon District Hospital.  This would leave residents in North Devon and Torridge over 90 minutes away from the nearest A&E.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is being systematically denied the resources it needs to deliver care in rural areas and a full Parliamentary board of Inquiry needs to be established to assess the funding necessary for providing vital services.  Community Hospitals have closed leading to pressure on the District Hospital that is now threatened with being downgraded because of lack of appropriate funding for the NHS.  The level of funding needs to be established but it also needs to be delivered.

attributes.action: WOMENS EQUALITY -PCOS sufferers deserve hair removal treatment on the NHS
attributes.background: As a woman with PCOS I suffer the effects of hair growth all over my body and face. It is embarrassing and degrading that as a woman I cannot feel feminine yet men are afforded the funding to be female and females are funded for treatments to be male. I deserve the same opportunities as do others.
attributes.additional_details: The nice guidelines do not warrant funding for hair removal treatments like electrolysis and laser treatments. The management of PCOS is not straight forward and generally becomes a weight related issue, however losing weight is difficult for women who have to suffer with PCOS due to the insulin resistant hormones and imbalances. More research needs to be done and this should be an equality right due to the nature of such a condition that removes a woman's ability to feel feminine in society.

attributes.action: Scan all dogs entering England, Scotland and Wales for microchips
attributes.background: There is an illegal trade in puppies which are kept in inhumane conditions in Ireland.Dogs can be taken across the border from Ireland to Northern Ireland and avoid any Pet Passport control.Microchip scanning on entry into England, Scotland and Wales at entry terminals would control this trade
attributes.additional_details: "Panorama" BBC "Britain's Puppy Dealers Exposed" 16/05/2016

attributes.action: Give legal rights to Aunties and Uncles
attributes.background: Recently my niece was taken into care but there was nothing I could do to stop that from happening because I'm just an auntie. I tried to contact the Solicitors for legal aid, but because I was just an auntie, I was told I have no rights to appeal or apply for custody. I want this changed.

attributes.action: Call EU suplementary Referendum for UK permanent residents without UKcitizenship
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the Westminster Parliament to implement the law on which basis all residents who have lived in the UK five years or longer should be allowed to vote in referendums. We call furthemore upon HM Government to call suplementary EU Referendum for this unrepresented residents.
attributes.additional_details: According to Office for National Statistics the latest release in 2014  estimate figure was 64.6 milions overall population in UK. Overview of the UK population from February 2016 showed that estimated population in mid-year of 2016 should be 65.52 milions. The population eligible to vote in last EU referendum in UK was 46.50 milions and that mean that about 20 milions (one third of all UK population) in June 2016 was efectively prevented from exercising their universal human right to vote.

attributes.action: Stop trading & supporting India until it stops human rights violation in Kashmir
attributes.background: Draconian laws such as AFSPA & PSA are used by India to commit human rights violations in Kashmir with impunity, over last 44 days of worst curfew imposed in Kashmir, Indian forces have killed over 70+ civilians, 200+ blinded using pellets, including young kids as young as 1 year, injured 8000+.
attributes.additional_details:
Insha, 14 year old is battling for her life due to serious brain injury after been hit by pellets aimed deliberately at upper body.

Essentials supplies like food, water & medicine have been curtailed, communication restricted, an ambulance driver shot while transporting patient to hospital, Lecturer dragged from home and beaten to death. 

We people of Britain have an obligation to put an end to these human rights violations.

attributes.action: Allow British Syrian professionals to sponsor a family member to live in the UK
attributes.background: We as professional Syrians in the UK are struggling without being able to bring a family member from a war zone and sponsor them to live in the UK, while others come illegally and enjoy the privileges of living in the UK.

attributes.action: Reduce the age limit on breast cancer screening to 40.
attributes.background: too many friends gone through cancer at 40 and they didn't even know they had it.

attributes.action: Ban Aspartame from all medicines.
attributes.background: Aspartame which has for years been the cheap artificial sweetener across the market from sweets through all kinds of medicines is finally beginning to be recognised as poison for many people. Some do not react to Aspartame, but many people get seriously ill when exposed to it    .
attributes.additional_details:
For some it attacks the immune system, others have linked it to their cancer and many many other serious bodily illnesses and dysfunctions.

There is zero need for this artificial sweetener in our medicines.

Major corporations like PepsiCo are beginning to take the artificial sweetener aspartame out of their products in response to consumer demand. What does the science say about how consuming aspartame could be harming your health?

Ref : http://aspartame.mercola.com/

attributes.action: Change the law so the councils must scan all dead pets for a microchip.
attributes.background:
Most people assume their cat would be scanned if found dead and collected by the council, and that they would be informed, but this is simply not the case. 

When a cat gets killed in a traffic accident, the councils have no legal obligation to scan for a microchip. This need to change.
attributes.additional_details:
The scanners are relatively cheap (£40) and all councils have them already to scan the stray dogs, since they are obliged to do that.

The change in law will be easy and inexpensive to implement. 
It will also save a lot of pet owners from the pain of not knowing what happened to their beloved pets.

attributes.action: National Safety Campaign to Raise Awareness of the Dangers of Distracted Driving
attributes.background:
The most recent awareness campaign was in 2012; since then the role of devices in our lives has hugely increased.

We believe a national safety campaign should be created that clearly and memorably restates the law and highlights the dangers and impact of using a hand-held device when driving.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst it has been illegal to use a handheld mobile phone when driving since 2003, there is significant research that shows motorists continue to use their devices incorrectly:

- 95% of motorists stated that they regularly see other drivers looking at their phones in stationary traffic 

- DoT figures show that motorists using their phones were involved in 3,611 crashes between 2009 and 2014. 

- 1 in 5 UK motorists admit accessing social networking sites on their mobile phone while driving.

attributes.action: SDR operation to be made available on the NHS for all children who need it.
attributes.background: Tommie was born at 30 weeks, and suffers with cerebral palsy  recently he was assed by a team at great Ormond street and was told he was eligible for an SDR op which is his only chance at walking independently however NHS wont fund it meaning its down to family/friends to find £25,000.00
attributes.additional_details: To get out of his wheel chair , Tommie needs to raise £25,000.00 shockingly other families have had to raise much more to help there children walk.

attributes.action: Give the people of Wales a referendum on independence
attributes.background:
Give the people of Wales a referendum on Welsh independence.

Cynnal refferendwm ar annibyniaeth Cymru.

attributes.action: Cut the NHS waiting list for military children when moving.
attributes.background:
My husband is in the military and we found out 2/3 of our children have SEN meaning they need services provided by NHS.

 we waited over a year for services, we finally get seen to then only get posted. We find out this means we go to the bottom of any list! Starting the process all over again.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm calling on the government to bring in a legislation that serving millitary families do NOT go to the bottom of the NHS waiting lists when they move. 
by the time you get the service you NEED you then get a posting order to only start the process again, meaning your at the bottom of the list! Meanwhile it has had a detremental effect in their development.

put something into place to protect them.  Our families already sacrifice so much, yet recive no support in this matter which is needed.

attributes.action: Mandatory whole life sentence for anyone convicted of murdering a child.
attributes.background: Anyone convicted of murdering a child should spend the rest of there life in prison, without the possibility of parole, the recent case involving Kathryn Smith, highlights how pathetic sentencing for these types of crime has become..
attributes.additional_details: As a parent I feel this Country needs tougher sentencing when it come to crimes against children..

attributes.action: make it legal requirement for public broadcasters to show disabled sports on TV
attributes.background: When London won the right to bid the 2012 summer olympics and Paralympics the slogan for the game was launched 'Inspire a Generation' But sadly what seems to have been forgotten is that the olympics and Paralympics only come around every four years and for the matter of a very short time.

attributes.action: Stop Evelyn Woods being deported I
attributes.background: Evelyn Woods has lived in Medway 50+ years. Evelyn has had her 3 children born here(unfortunately one past away in 2003) was married and widowed here. This problem came to light when Evelyn got a job,after 3 months was told she couldn't work here and was facing deportation.
attributes.additional_details: Kent online have recently interviews Evelyn and Kelly Tolhurst Mp has been liasioning with the home office.

attributes.action: Hold another UK EU referendum in which UK residents can vote alongside Brits
attributes.background: The results of the UK EU referendum does not accurately reflect the wishes of the country and that is because UK residents were not granted a vote.  UK residents deserve to have a voice in the future of their country.
attributes.additional_details:
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) Labour Force Survey estimated in 2015, there are 3.3 million EU citizens residing in the UK.

UK residents have been calling this country home for years.  They work here, pay taxes, have had children here, own property and yet they didn't have a say in the future of what is also their country.  

A new referendum must be held to include their voice.

attributes.action: Free sun cream for all school children
attributes.background: I have been recently been diagnosed with skin cancer, being only 28 this has come as a bit of a shock. being a red head, fair skinned , and freckly I always kept an eye on skin changes but you still think it wont happen to you. This then flagged up and made me take notice the price of sun cream.
attributes.additional_details:
Every child should have access to sun cream, especially march-October, teachers, anybody in a position of care to a child should be allowed to apply sun cream where they see fit.
Sun damage ages the skin but also raises the risk of skin cancer, one of the most preventable cancer. I believe all school children should receive a 'sunstart' pack containing a sun hat, sun cream, and information sheet, a bottle of water , and an activity pack. FREE SUN CREAM FOR ALL SCHOOL CHILDREN.

attributes.action: Make the DVLA selling your information to private companies illegal
attributes.background: We find it a breach of confidentiality that the DVLA can sell on our vehicle information without permission to private companies because they paid to do so.Therefore we propose a law change in which our vehicle information can only be accessed by law enforcement and local authorities.
